channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Researchers and politicians have latched onto antibodies as a potential solution to the virus and an outlet from containment measures.
item.title: Italians find promise of antibodies remains elusive, for now

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: Countdown to ease restrictions in the state as QLD reports fewer than 20 'active' cases

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Fears over COVID-19-linked Kawasaki disease sparks calls for urgent research, global cases surpass 4.2 million as Australian death toll stands at 98

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card at Warwick Farm.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Warwick Farm on Wednesday

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: WHO sees 'potentially positive data' in treating virus, global death toll passes 290,000

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Soil tests commissioned by Transurban and presented to public environmental hearings on the tunnel did not screen for potentially carcinegetic chemicals PFAS.
item.title: No PFAS screening listed in Transurban tests on West Gate Tunnel soil

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: In a trading update, the banking giant announced the deal, while also revealing it took an extra $1.5 billion charge for bad loans from the pandemic.
item.title: CBA sells majority Colonial stake to KKR for $1.7 billion

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The Captain Cook bridge and the Inner Northern Busway will both see closures over the coming months.
item.title: Commuter headache on the horizon as bridge and bus station work begins

item.description: More than 200 people are set to finish their Rottnest Island quarantine as Western Australian authorities continue to investigate the state's latest coronavirus case.
item.title: Opening Rottnest 'some time away' as hundreds complete quarantine

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Police have released a digitally-altered image of missing man Paul Wright, last seen leaving his home in suburban Melbourne.
item.title: Police release digitally altered image of man missing for 17 years

item.description: Speculation is rife in the F1 world after Ferrari announced Sebastian Vettel's departure but Max Verstappen doesn't expect to see Daniel Ricciardo in red.
item.title: Ex-Red Bull teammate doesn't expect Ricciardo to jump ship to Ferrari

item.description: Mining giant chiefs are eyeing opportunities despite the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: BHP sticks with spending strategy, Rio eyes M&A amid coronavirus shock

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: The Last Dance, along with The Test and Sunderland 'Til I Die, is one of several recent documentaries that speaks with uncharacteristic honesty about elite sport.
item.title: Michael Jordan pierces the bubble of elite sport in juicy ESPN doco

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: Westpork is WA's largest pork producer, and this new proposed boar semen collection facility would be its ninth pig farm across the south-west of the state.
item.title: Westpork to expand empire, proposing boar stud farm in Bullsbrook

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: While NAPLAN has been scrapped and some West Australian schools have cancelled semester one tests altogether, some students haven’t got off that lightly.
item.title: 'Level playing field': Prestigious WA girls school students sit exams at home

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Banks have taken the knife to term deposit and savings interest rates, as extraordinary stimulus policies drive down the cost of money.
item.title: Banks slash savings rates on back of RBA moves

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: Wall Street's tumble sets up ASX for losses

item.description: China acted swiftly to control the resurgence, issuing an urgent directive the day after Wuhan reported six new COVID-19 infections over the weekend.
item.title: Wuhan to test 11 million people as virus rebounds

item.description: An investment strategy of "don't just do something, sit there" has served me well over the years. So it was with some trepidation that I set it aside.
item.title: Why I cashed out of the COVID-19 sharemarket rally

item.description: More than 100 passengers from Australia and New Zealand were flown home from the Antarctic cruise ship in April, but the crew remained on board.
item.title: Australian-owned cruise ship crew disembark in Uruguay

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: A 64-year-old man has been charged with murder after a woman's body was found in a home in Bendoc, East Gippsland.
item.title: Man charged after woman's body found in isolated East Gippsland town

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Mitt Romney hit out at the Trump administration for boasting about its roll-out of coronavirus testing, saying he found it "nothing to celebrate whatsoever".
item.title: 'Serious consequences': Fauci warns US against premature re-opening

item.description: Faced with surging coronavirus deaths, state and city governments are lurching forward with mandatory lockdowns against the will of President Jair Bolsonaro.
item.title: Needing to 'avoid a total disaster', Brazil's cities lean toward lockdowns

item.description: Stocks tumbled after a US official warned against a premature reopening of the economy amid a dire outlook from Federal Reserve regional chiefs.
item.title: Wall Street dives after Fauci, Fed set sombre tone

item.description: David Calhoun says air travel will take years to return to pre-virus levels and says the risk is growing of airline bankruptcies.
item.title: Boeing CEO fears pandemic will force major US airline to collapse

item.description: Dmitry Peskov, traditionally the official with the closest day-to-day access to Putin, said in a text message he last met with the president in person over a month ago.
item.title: Putin's spokesman gets coronavirus as cases soar in Russia

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: After weeks of negotiations, during which Nine threatened to walk away from the sport, the free-to-air network is now on the verge of recommitting to the NRL.
item.title: Nine, NRL on brink of deal to seal $1.9 billion broadcast bonanza

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: Christopher Binse, a prodigious armed robber and expert escape artist who led police on a cat-and-mouse chase over 30 years, has opened up to one of his pursuers.
item.title: Naked City podcast: The crook and the cop

item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has emerged as a champion of defying stay-home orders intended to stop the coronavirus from spreading, and now he has the US president's support.
item.title: 'Open the plant. Now': Trump backs Elon Musk's Tesla in pandemic stoush

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Australia's top health experts have asked for an urgent report into a mysterious coronavirus-linked illness suspected to have killed three US children.
item.title: Experts call for urgent research on coronavirus-linked child disease

item.dc:creator: Benjamen Judd
item.description: With the global economy in lockdown, “pivoting” has become the survival mechanism for small business owners.
item.title: A chance encounter prompted this business owner's COVID-19 pivot

item.description: Start with a sense of self-worth and compassion. Weight management is a positive process, not a punitive one. Beating yourself up is not helpful, it's demotivating.
item.title: How to lose weight and keep it off? Make it a moderate and positive process

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: A look at the follies, foibles and joys of the human race through the eyes of cartoonist Michael Leunig. Buy prints from Michael Leunig at https://www.thestore.com.au/category/artists/michael-leunig. Join us on Facebook at the Michael Leunig Appreciation Page.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Michael Leunig

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Barilaro told MPs in a joint party room meeting on Tuesday that he was sorry, after he and Transport Minister Andrew Constance spent weeks focused on contesting the byelection.
item.title: 'Sorry for being a distraction': Barilaro apologises to Coalition MPs

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Storm star believes he didn't break any social-distancing laws during his controversial trip to Latrell Mitchell's farm in Taree last month.
item.title: Addo-Carr to fight NRL, police fines for social-distancing breach

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The government will this week push ahead with a parliamentary inquiry into the class action industry, including the profits made by litigation funders that bankroll claims on behalf of Australians.
item.title: Government pushes ahead with class action inquiry

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: Let's not go back to politics as usual. It wasn't working.
item.title: What politicians can do to impress us as the COVID-19 crisis dials down

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The federal government will on Wednesday launch a new toolkit to help front-line workers identify telltale signs of technology-based abuse.
item.title: Global toolkit to help front-line workers combat scourge of domestic violence

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Whatever politicians thought about Alan Jones, his influence was something they could not turn away from, not least for how he leveraged it across print and TV as well as radio.
item.title: Loved, loathed and feared, no one could ignore the Jones phenomenon

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: Facebook, Twitter, memes and hashtags formed the basis of a campaign that seriously weakened the broadcaster.
item.title: The hashtag that shook the foundations of Alan Jones' power

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: M3 Capital Partners’ principal investment vehicle has sold its Urbanest Australia platform to global operator Scape in Australia's largest ever student accommodation deal.
item.title: Scape seals $2b Urbanest student digs deal

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Virgin Australia would continue to operate an international network flying to Los Angeles and Tokyo under a confidential management plan put to prospective buyers.
item.title: Virgin to keep international flights under plan put to potential buyers

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Global fund manager Nuveen Real Estate has defied market uncertainty with the sale of a major stake in a Brisbane shopping centre to a family-run business for $285 million.
item.title: Nuveen Real Estate raises $285m by offloading Brisbane shopping centre

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: One elderly woman was abused on the street, while other people have been spat at and blamed for the spread of COVID-19, according to research.
item.title: Asian-Australian groups report surge in racist abuse, assaults during pandemic

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: On the lookout for some new books to read to your little ones? These five titles will thrill children and adults alike.
item.title: Top five board books for babies, as selected by bookseller David Gaunt

item.dc:creator: Chris Uhlmann
item.description: A cliff is looming in September when the JobSeeker payment is due to halve and the JobKeeper allowance cuts out.
item.title: The hardest thing Morrison will ever have to do is ahead of him
